name: "Seafaring" **SOLD**
description: "Seafaring" 5.20 troy oz. Cast .925 Sterling Silver 2.5" x 1.5" x 2" Unique, 1/1 Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation. "Seafaring" is inspired by the cult film and dark comedy "The Life Aquatic With Steve Zissou." The piece was created exclusively for Spoke Art Gallery's annual show "Bad Dads: A Tribute to Wes Anderson 4" and the piece contains elements and symbols from the film including the jaguar shark, The Belafonte, a pair of albino dolphins, sticks of dynamite, and two tailfins from florescent snapper.

name: "Hiring"
description:
PLEASE NOTE: 
"Hiring" is currently on exhibition at the Beijing MOCA and will be available mid-late November 2013.

If collecting, please purchase and the piece will be shipped to you as early as is possible. Thank you. 
*********************************

"Hiring" 
4.128 troy oz
Cast .925 Sterling Silver 
3.5" x 1.5" x 1" 
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

A comment on the economically skewed workforce, "Hiring" shows
an abundance of unemployed professionals, bought for a smaller price than they might normally demand, spat onto a conveyor belt and become part of an inexpensive assembly line. The pressures and responsibilities of operating the vending machine is powered by a lone gear shifter, as the hiring market begins to have fewer blue collar workers available.

name: "Ringmaster" **SOLD**
description:
PLEASE NOTE: 
"Ringmaster" is currently on exhibition at the Beijing MOCA and will be available mid-late November 2013.

If collecting, please purchase and the piece will be shipped to you as early as is possible. Thank you. 
*********************************

"Ringmaster" 
2.11 troy oz/59.8 grams 
Cast .925 Sterling Silver 
2.75" x 1" x .75" 
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Ringmaster" symbolizes our dance with Father Time. Three people running from the clock and watch represent our efforts to flee time. Despite our attempts, time will eventually catch up with us. The front view of the shank is a timepiece, on the reverse, a clown peers from the back of the grandfather clock and overlooks a cemetery, like the ringmaster of a circus, time is ultimately the ringmaster of life.

name: "Bordering" **SOLD**
description:
"Bordering"
5 troy oz. / 142 grams 
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
2.25" x 2" x 1.5"
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation. 

"Bordering" illustrates the artist's experiences growing up near the US/ Mexico Border, and confronts the hypocrisies she witnessed from Arizonans to Mexicans. The piece depicts currency from both countries, snakes, a pharmaceutical cap, and seemingly similar landscapes that are separated by a single fence. Ultimately the piece echoes the basic human experience that we are all the same, urging us to treat each other as such. Constructed in two sections, the top, which represents the landscape, intentionally spins and screws into the base, which represents the economy.

name: "Toe Ring"
description: PLEASE PURCHASE THROUGH: Lawren Alice, Arch Enemy Arts Gallery Thank you! ******************************* "Toe Ring" 3.71 troy oz. Cast .925 Sterling Silver 3" x 1" x 1.5" Unique, 1/1 Comes with Sculpturing, Wall Hung Suspension Box, Magnifying Glass, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation. "Toe Ring" was created for the "No Place for Cucumber Trees" show held at Arch Enemy Arts Gallery in Philadelphia April 2013. The show honored the art and animation style of Terry Gilliam, and this piece pays homage to his opening credits for Monty Python's Flying Circus". ******************************* PLEASE PURCHASE THROUGH: Lawren Alice, Arch Enemy Arts Gallery

name: "Sugaring"
description:
PLEASE NOTE:
"Sugaring" is currently on exhibition at the Beijing MOCA and will be available mid-late November 2013.

If collecting, please purchase and the piece will be shipped to you as early as is possible. Thank you.
*********************************

"Sugaring" 
2.63 troy oz. 
Cast .925 Sterling Silver 
2 1/4" x 1 1/2" x 1" 
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Sugaring" Is about the growing epidemic  of onset child diabetes. With childhood diabetes on the rise, it’s necesary now more than ever to observe and reevaluate how high of a sugar intake children can handle. The portions children are inundated with is more than their smaller developing bodies can deal with, so everything sugary here- sweets, cupcakes, candy, and ice cream- are larger than they should be. The stethescope is held up to the powerful sundae, taking control and listening to the child’s heartbeat, with it's finger on the pulse of the child's declining health.

name: "Soldering" **ON HOLD**
description:
** Please Note: "Soldering" is included in an upcoming issue of Art Jewelry magazine, and is physically at the publisher's office for production & photos shoots. If interested in collecting this piece, please email me and I will send notification upon it's availability. **

"Soldering" 
5.17 troy oz. 
Cast .925 Sterling Silver 
2 1/2" x 1 3/4" x 1 3/8" 
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Soldering" is the Inception of rings: oddly enough, it's a ring all about making rings. The bands are rings sizers themselves, with the size tabs still attached. A torch & oxy/acetylene tanks, two major tools key in the production of jewelry, accompanied with pliers, denatured alcohol lamp, and protective eye gear. This piece is a physical continuation of my big picture aim: that jewelry can be seen as a piece of sculpture.

name: "Ring Pop" **SOLD**
description:
***SOLD***
"Ring Pop"
2.677 troy oz
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
2 1/4" x 1 1/8" x 3/4"
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Ring Pop" is about the housing crisis of 2008. Bubble wands depict the bubble burst of the housing collapse. The dice facing forward shows a facade of worth, when looked from the back, land on snake eyes. The owner, fed up as his money spills out, sits on an upside down house. Another house upright to symbolize that the foreclosure on every street might be your neighbor.

name: "Planetary Ring"
description: "Planetary Ring" 2.21 troy oz. Cast .925 Sterling Silver 2" x 2" x 3/4" Unique, 1/1 Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation. "Planetary Ring" was created for the "Planet Sin: Space Vixens A Go-Go" show held at 423 West Gallery in March 2013. It depicts a sultry space cadet riding a rocket under a beam of shooting stars. The band is textured to resemble moon rock.

name: "Detouring"
description:
"Detouring"
5.55 troy oz. / 157 grams 
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
2.5" x 2" x 1"
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation. 

In "Detouring" spectators watch sports in lieu of participating, and are detouring from their own health and fitness. The piece contains, runners, remotes, hazard cones, an upside down caduceus, and TV set.

name: "Pioneering"
description:
"Pioneering"
3.027 troy oz
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
2 1/2” x 1 1/4” x 3/4”
Limited Edition of 10

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Pioneering" illustrates the growing popularity of alternative fuels. The ear of corn and kernels radiate from the car, the gas cans lay on their bellyside, helpless to the future of alternate fuels. The most literal interpretation is the use of alternate fuels over oil is a pioneering idea.

name: "Engagement Ring"
description:
"Engagement Ring"
2.546 troy oz
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
2 5/8” x 1 1/8” x 1”
Limited Edition of 10

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Engagement Ring" depicts the moments after popping the question, a couple embraces among towering champagne flutes and a ring hangs around the the neck of a champagne bottle.

name: "Inspiring"
description:
"Inspiring"
3.127 troy oz/88.6 grams
Cast .925 Sterling Silver 
2.25" x 1.5" x 1.5
Limited Edition of 10

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Inspiring" is designed to illustrate the effects graffiti and street art has had on the modern art world. For fine artists whose work is pigenholed as something less, nothing can be more inspiring than seeing art genres redefined and bonafide, like street art and graf which for so long was dismissed as vandalism. Celebrating the urban art trifecta, 3 spray nozzles represent street art mingled with 3 brushes representing fine art. Fairey’s winged spray can, Banksy’s rat, and MBW’s brain, sit atop a skateboard for the mobility of the genre. The brain and rat rest on the same plane, a nod to theories they represent the same artist. Prize ribbons grace the sides to show the artists’ victory over the collective, dismissive view.

name: "Sharing" **SOLD**
description:
****SOLD****
"Sharing" 
5.230 troy oz. 
Cast .925 Sterling Silver 
2 3/4" x 1 1/4" x 1 1/4" 
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Sharing" celebrates the idea of home and community, rich with safe and sound security. No matter our age, sometimes the quickest thing that can give us the feeling of home sweet home is a big bowl of Mom’s spaghetti. The aroma of the sauce wafting through the air, and the urge to sneak a spoonful to taste before she yelled out “You’ll spoil your dinner," both akin to notions you were going to be securely provided for and nourished. As society ages however, that sector of humanity at times is forgotten, leaving seniors without the company of family and without that secure feeling of being taken care of by a watchful, loving eye.  With ongoing generosity, through organizations like Meals on Wheels, the elderly couple sitting on the edge of a heaping serving of pasta, sauce, and meatballs, can grab a fork and dive into those memories.

name: "Repairing"
description:
"Repairing"
3.231 troy oz/
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
3 1/4” x 1 1/8” x 3/4”
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Repairing" contains hands that are planting flowers with shovels and soil. The hands are cut off to symbolize anonymity, as a call to action for all of us to participate in beautifying our world. The shank resembles dirt and a barren Earth.
Bandages represent the literal take of mending and repairing.

name: "Acquiring"
description:
PLEASE NOTE:
"Acquiring" is currently on exhibition at the Beijing MOCA and will be available mid-late November 2013.

If collecting, please purchase and the piece will be shipped to you as early as is possible. Thank you.
*********************************

"Acquiring"
3.55 troy oz/101 grams
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
2.25" x 1.25" x 1"
Unique, 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Acquiring" is based on the habit of acquiring mass amounts of consumer goods on borrowed money, and the appearance of wealth piled high on credit.

name: "Featuring"
description:
"Featuring" 
3.215 troy oz.
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
2 1/4" x 1 1/8" x 1"
Limited Edition of 5

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Featuring" is inspired by the adult entertainment industry. Cameramen & photographers surround & fix their lenses on the featured woman. Is the woman more powerful in adult films because without her the product is less appealing? Do we, the audience, watch by mere intrigue or satisfied entertainment? A photographer dangles on a lens, pointing a camera at us, the voyeur.

name: "Purring" **SOLD**
description: "Purring" 3.71 troy oz. Cast .925 Sterling Silver 3" x 1" x 1.5" Unique, 1/1 Comes with Sculpturing, Glass Cloche Dome with Engraved Base and Armature, Travel Pouch, Magnifying Glass, and Signed/Numbered/Dated/Fingerprinted Documentation. "Purring" was created for the "Lil' Bub Art Show" held at Spoke Art Gallery in San Francisco September 2013. The show honored the cutest little feline on the interwebs: Lil Bub! View the Original Rendering Sketch here: .

name: "Careering"
description:
"Careering"
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
4.024 troy oz 
Unique, 1/1
2 1/4” x 1 3/4” x 1”

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

The body as canvas; a newer and increasingly popular form of art and career path. Most body painters begin by learning swirls on faces, and work from a bin similar to this. Tools of the trade that are represented are: paintbrushes in a paint cup, q-tips, liquid makeup, a sponge applicator, theatrical makeup, and a hand mirror. On each side, a swirly crown is painted on faces. 

Another facet to the piece "Careering" is from my own experience, responding to countless remarks from people growing up saying "You'll never make a living off of that" and "Why don't you settle for a real job?" Surprisingly, face and body painting is becoming a popular career path for avante garde artists who embrace the idea of temporary art, and are successfully proving those aforementioned remarks false while creating a new art form.

name: "Soaring" **SOLD**
description:
"Soaring"
3.75 troy oz/ 105 grams
Cast .925 Sterling Silver
2.5” x 1.5” x .75”
Unique 1/1

Comes with Sculpturing, Hand Blown Glass Cloche Dome, Black Engraved Base with Armature, Travel Pouch, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation.

"Soaring" is my interpretation of the rapper Birdman. I was first intrigued by him because he's a connoisseur of large rings, but after researching his story and rise to fame, I found that very little information existed about his childhood and early life, as if it was so bad that he was compelled to soar beyond his beginnings and beyond Bryan Williams.

This thought intrigued me further and I began thinking about the millions of people who do the same, keeping their childhood and upbringing a secret, and how successful one can become by being the phoenix that rises from the ashes. Through this thought, my admiration for his ambition and success grew deeper, and his empire proves he's soared as high in the sky as his name suggests. 

The symbols represented literally in the Sculpturing are two birds and stereos, with headphones creating the band. On the back of the ring, two hands folded over one another create bird wings, and the singer is shown with his trademark sunglasses, mic, and star tattoo on top of his head.

name: Sculpturings: The Bronze Collection "Ringmaster"
description:
"Ringmaster"
2.106 oz.
Cast Bronze
2 3/4" x 1" x 3/4"
Limited Edition of XX/50

Includes Bronze Sculpturing, Black Clamshell Suspension Display Box, Outer Box, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation by the artist.

"Ringmaster" illustrates our futile attempts to control time. Three people running from the clock and watch represent our effort to flee time, despite our best efforts, it will eventually catch up with us. The front view of the shank is a timepiece, on the reverse, a clown peers from the back of the grandfather clock and overlooks a cemetery, like the ringmaster of a circus, time is ultimately the ringmaster of life.

description:
"Ringlets" 
1.96 oz.
Cast Bronze
1 1/2" x 1" x 1"
Limited Edition of XX/50

Includes Bronze Sculpturing, Black Clamshell Suspension Display Box, Outer Box, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation by the artist.

"Ringlets" heralds the products, tools, and items hairstylists rely on: hair dryers, curling irons, brushes, & the band is a section of an old fashioned hair roller. A delight for artists whose medium is human hair.

name: Sculpturings: The Bronze Collection "Pioneering"
description:
"Pioneering" 
3.207 oz.
Cast Bronze
2 1/2" x 1 1/4" x 3/4"
Limited Edition of XX/50

"Pioneering" illustrates the growing popularity of alternative fuels. The ear of corn and kernels radiate from the car, the gas cans lay on their bellyside, helpless to the future of alternate fuels. The most literal interpretation is the use of alternate fuels over oil is a pioneering idea.

name: Sculpturings: The Bronze Collection "Triggering"
description:
"Triggering" 
2.049 oz.
Cast Bronze
2" x 1 1/8" x 3/4"
Limited Edition of XX/50

Includes Bronze Sculpturing, Black Clamshell Suspension Display Box, Outer Box, and Signed, Numbered, Dated, Fingerprinted Documentation by the artist.

Neither a pro-war piece nor an anti-war piece, "Triggering" is designed to trigger emotions and trigger thought about how most focus on the act of war itself and the controversy of war but tend to forget individual soldiers. Atop the army backpack sits two pistols, and flowers growing from an upside down army helmut representing a fallen soldier. Underneath the back pack, visible only if you remove the ring and look underneath, is the face of the soldier.

name: Sculpturings: The Bronze Collection "Inspiring"
description:

 and bonafide, like street art and graf which for so long was dismissed as vandalism. description:
Graphite on Heavyweight Rives BFK Archival Paper 
9" x 12"

Comes in a Black Wood Frame, 
Wired and Ready for Hanging, 
Double Matted in Cream & Black,
Signed by Rebecca Rose.
Unique, 1/1

During the concept/design phase of creating a new piece, I usually sketch it out to solidify the composition, and make sure the message is properly conveyed.
